alert.note: Alert for Clark; Coles; Cumberland; Edgar; Effingham; Jasper; Moultrie; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Coles, southern Edgar, southeastern Moultrie, northwestern Jasper, Clark, southeastern Shelby, Cumberland and northern Effingham Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 928 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Vermilion to 6 miles south of Shelbyville. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Paris around 935 PM CDT. Vermilion around 940 PM CDT. Stewardson around 945 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Beecher City, Shumway, Effingham, Altamont and Dennison. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 between mile markers 154 and 192. Interstate 70 between mile markers 79 and 154. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and east central Illinois.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Coles; Cumberland; Edgar; Effingham; Jasper; Moultrie; Shelby
